TITLE: 2008 ford fusion sel v6
ATTR: VIN: 3FAHP08178R194488#condition: fair#cylinders: 6 cylinders#drive: fwd#fuel: gas#odometer: 128640#paint color: silver#size: full-size#title status: clean#transmission: automatic#type: sedan
MESSAGE: 2008 ford fusion sel v6#mpg: up to 20 city / 29 highway#horsepower: 221 hp#fuel tank capacity: 16.6 to 17.5 gal#i recently purchased a new vehicle so its time for me to say good-bye to my 2008 fusion. i am the second owner of the vehicle and owned it for 7 years. the fusion is in overall fair condition. mechanically the vehicle has been solid but there is an indication of a small oil leak near the engine; which i have not had a mechanic give a quote on the repair. i have used fully synthetic oil since owning the car and recently had an oil change. also; within the past year i had a complete transmission service and replaced all tires with highly rated continental purecontacts. i will include snow-chains with the purchase of the vehicle.#the interior is in good condition. 6-disk cd changer --sometimes gets jammed; bluetooth compatible --i havent been able to connect to the bluetooth in recent years--it may need an update from the dealership. there is an aux port and 2 usb ports in the center console. the vehicle ride is comfortable and it seats 4 comfortably with a lot of trunk space.#the exterior of the vehicle has seen better days. the front left turn signal and rear brake lights need to replaced. the clear coat on the rear passenger door has worn through and the paint is fading. the front bumper clips are broken; but the front  bumper is still in place and seems to be secure. the driver side rear fender had a recent brush-up and is scratched.#smog check completed and passed on july 3rd 2017.#the vehicle is being sold as is.

MESSAGE: hello;#i am selling my 2014 ford fusion titanium hybrid. this car looks awesome and drives even better. i bought it in wisconsin towards the end of 2014 and used it as a commuter car for 2 years before i moved back home to nj where i work in the city and no longer need a car. in the three years that ive owned it; the car has been garaged for all but 6 months. ive never had a single mechanical issue with the car and the electronics (bluetooth connectivity; keyless entry; sound; etc.) work better than in my buddys mercedes benz. its still under factory warranty for bumper; powertrain; roadside assist and hybrid.#things i love about this car:#- keyless start/entry: i never touch my keys.#- winter warrior: i drove it in wisconsin for 2 years and i never had an issue; even going up hills. heated seats and remote starter are huge in the colder months.#- efficient: the car is rated 44 mpg city and 41 mpg highway. ive gotten a little less than that (37 - 41 mpg) but im shocked at how little i spend on gas!#- storage: its got way more trunk than your average hybrid and the seats fold down to allow additional storage. ive moved in this car alone.#- sound: the deluxe sony sound system will knock your socks off. the bass is deep and it gets loud. usb; bluetooth and aux plugs.#- connectivity: my phone pairs flawlessly. the touchscreen works amazingly well.#- the look: check the pictures.#park assist: never. parallel. park. again.#moonroof#other things: all records; no accidents; one owner; perfect first car#be advised: the car has a couple minor dings shown in final 2 pictures. 1) there is a scratch on the right bumper which has been touched up with ford-factory paint. 2) there is a slight dent in the passenger door.
